materials.raw_text: Co: 110 g, Ni: 70 g, P: 120 g, Ru: 20 g, Tm: 40 g

sourcing.instructions: Co: Purchase from a metal supplier or online retailer specializing in metals. Ni: Obtain from a supplier of industrial metals. P: Available at chemical supply stores. Ru: Source from precious metal suppliers. Tm: Obtain from specialized rare earth metal suppliers.
steps: Co: Purchase from a metal supplier or online retailer specializing in metals. Ni: Obtain from a supplier of industrial metals. P: Available at chemical supply stores. Ru: Source from precious metal suppliers. Tm: Obtain from specialized rare earth metal suppliers.

1. Weigh each metal using a precision scale. 2. Place Co, Ni, P, Ru, and Tm in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mechanical stirrer to mix the powders thoroughly for 15 minutes to ensure uniformity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each metal using a precision scale. 2. Place Co, Ni, P, Ru, and Tm in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mechanical stirrer to mix the powders thoroughly for 15 minutes to ensure uniformity.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to 1200째C for 2 hours to facilitate alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to 1200째C for 2 hours to facilitate alloy formation.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C). This may take 3-4 hours.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C). This may take 3-4 hours.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally apply a protective sealant if necessary.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally apply a protective sealant if necessary.
